timeline.message:
Rework inspection of tenant permissions results in tests

The X-Tenant-Perms-Result was used to return permissions that
were posted (_tenantPermissions). A very bad idea when permissions
can become larger than 8k. Instead header module has a service
to retrieve most recently permissions (/permResult).
Test trace header for system call

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
.extract().body().asString();
JsonArray ar = new JsonArray(body);
context.assertEquals(2, ar.size());
context.assertEquals("okapi-0.0.0", ar.getJsonObject(0).getString("moduleId"));
context.assertEquals("header-1", ar.getJsonObject(1).getString("moduleId"));
.body("$", hasSize(2))
.body("[0].moduleId", is("okapi-0.0.0"))
.body("[1].moduleId", is("header-1"));

RestAssured has JSON path (GPath syntax) support. Simply use a recent RestAssured version, put RestAssured.defaultParser = Parser.JSON; into setUp, and import the hamcrest matcher:

+import static org.hamcrest.collection.IsCollectionWithSize.hasSize;
+import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.is;
timeline.author: julianladisch

replies.bodyText: yet another way of doing things.. But shorter, so I've done that.

timeline.body: encode() does not guarantee the order of the keys. You probably want to compare without encode().
